attributes.action: Require MPs to give clear and direct answers to serious questions
attributes.additional_details: We ask UK Parliament to strengthen standards of conduct so MPs provide clear and relevant answers to serious questions. Parliament should discourage the use of jokes, deflection or avoidance during scrutiny, ensuring debates are conducted with seriousness, transparency and respect for the British public.
attributes.background: Require MPs to provide clear and relevant answers to serious questions and discourage the use of jokes, deflection or avoidance during parliamentary scrutiny, so debates are conducted with seriousness and respect for the British public.

departments.name: Office of the Leader of the House of Commons

rejection.details: We are not sure how this would differ from current guidance given by the Chair to Members.
